sources.title: "The Yaqui Cur" (1913) director D. W. Griffith starring Robert Harron
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation     "The Yaqui Cur" is a short Indian drama, included in our program to illustrate the work of Robert Harron and Billy Bitzer, stars of Silent Hall of Fame.   A young Indian man learns from white prospectors that self-sacrifice is the biggest virtue. Later he gets kicked out of the tribe and pays a heavy price.   Directed by                       D.W. Griffith Cinematography by         Billy Bitzer Starring                             Robert Harron, Kate Bruce, Walter Miller, Lionel Barrymore Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                      May 17, 1913 Country                             United States Running time                    17 m.   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. metadata.Plot: The prospector had taught the Indian boy the doctrine of peace. When his tribe resisted the attack of another tribe the boy did not take part. The din of the battle, as the horsemen circled them again and again, the moans of men caught under falling horses struck terror in the boy's heart The incensed warriors cast him from the tribe with the brand of a coward. It was then that his opportunity came to follow the white man's wonderful doctrine. "Big love man lay down life for friend,"
metadata.Actors: Robert Harron, Kate Bruce, Walter Miller
